awd_titl_txt: RUI: Effects of Regulation on the Price and Quality of ChildCare
awd_abstract_narration: The purpose of this research is to develop models for child care                for estimating the effect of regulation on the quality of care                  children receive and the price that families, government, and                   employers pay for care.  Hedonic models are developed which                     provide a means of incorporating the pervasive heterogeneity of                 child care services.  Knowledge of the effect of regulation on                  the price and quality of care is valuable for informing the                     public and private debate regarding child care policy and may                   allow adoption of child care policies that more efficiently                     achieve quality care for children.  To estimate the models,                     national data collected by the 1990 National Child Care Survey                  and the Profile of Child Care Settings are used.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Social and Economic Sciences
